intro: Echium ramosum, commonly known as the branched blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Echium ramosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soil.
